intro: Epilobium cordatum, commonly known as the heartleaf willow herb, is a herbaceous plant native to North America. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist habitats such as stream banks and wet meadows. It belongs to the Onagraceae family, which includes other flowering plants with showy blooms. Epilobium cordatum is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
